descriptions: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Serperior
descriptions: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Tepig
descriptions: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Pignite
descriptions: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Emboar
descriptions: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Oshawott
descriptions: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Dewott
descriptions: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Samurott
descriptions: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Hisuian Samurott
descriptions: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Patrat
descriptions: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Watchog
descriptions: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Lillipup
descriptions: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

name: Herdier
descriptions: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Stoutland
descriptions: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Purrloin
descriptions: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.

abilities.name: Limber
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.

name: Liepard
descriptions: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

abilities.name: Limber
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.

name: Pansage
descriptions: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Simisage
descriptions: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Pansear
descriptions: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Simisear
descriptions: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Panpour
descriptions: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Simipour
descriptions: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Munna
descriptions: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.
Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

name: Musharna
descriptions: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

name: Pidove
descriptions: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.

abilities.name: Super Luck
abilities.description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

name: Tranquill
descriptions: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.

abilities.name: Super Luck
abilities.description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

name: Male
descriptions: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.

abilities.name: Super Luck
abilities.description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

name: Female
descriptions: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
Females of this species are very capable fliers, particularly notable for their stamina. They also take longer to adjust to people.

abilities.name: Super Luck
abilities.description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

name: Blitzle
descriptions: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

name: Zebstrika
descriptions: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

name: Roggenrola
descriptions: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.
It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Boldore
descriptions: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.
If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Gigalith
descriptions: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation—they can only be fired when the sun is out.
This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Woobat
descriptions: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target’s stat changes.

name: Swoobat
descriptions: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target’s stat changes.

name: Drilbur
descriptions: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.
It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

abilities.name: Sand Rush
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm.

name: Excadrill
descriptions: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.
It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.

abilities.name: Sand Rush
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm.

name: Audino
descriptions: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.
Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.

abilities.name: Healer
abilities.description: Sometimes cures the status conditions of the Pokémon’s allies.

name: Mega Audino
descriptions: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

abilities.name: Healer
abilities.description: Sometimes cures the status conditions of the Pokémon’s allies.

name: Timburr
descriptions: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Gurdurr
descriptions: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.
It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Conkeldurr
descriptions: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Tympole
descriptions: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.
Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: Cures the Pokémon’s status conditions in rain.

name: Palpitoad
descriptions: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: Cures the Pokémon’s status conditions in rain.

name: Seismitoad
descriptions: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

name: Throh
descriptions: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Sawk
descriptions: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Sewaddle
descriptions: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Swadloon
descriptions: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Leavanny
descriptions: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Venipede
descriptions: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Whirlipede
descriptions: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.
This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Scolipede
descriptions: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Cottonee
descriptions: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.
It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

abilities.name: Prankster
abilities.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s status moves.

name: Whimsicott
descriptions: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

abilities.name: Prankster
abilities.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s status moves.

name: Petilil
descriptions: If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Lilligant
descriptions: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Hisuian Lilligant
descriptions: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Red-Striped Form Basculin
descriptions: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Thug of the River. Yet Basculin is still targeted by predators, such as Dondozo and Bombirdier.
Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokémon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.

abilities.name: Reckless
abilities.description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

name: Blue-Striped Form Basculin
descriptions: The power of its jaws is immense—enough to leave teeth marks in iron sheets. Its personality is also extremely vicious.
These Pokémon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.

abilities.name: Rock Head
abilities.description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

name: White-Striped Form Basculin
descriptions: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

abilities.name: Adaptability
abilities.description: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.

name: Sandile
descriptions: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Krokorok
descriptions: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Krookodile
descriptions: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Darumaka
descriptions: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

abilities.name: Hustle
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but lowers its accuracy.

name: Galarian Darumaka
descriptions: The colder they get, the more energetic they are. They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.
It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.

abilities.name: Hustle
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but lowers its accuracy.

name: Darmanitan (Standard Mode)
descriptions: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon’s moves, but increases the moves’ power.

name: Galarian Darmanitan (Standard Mode)
descriptions: Though it has a gentle disposition, it’s also very strong. It will quickly freeze the snowball on its head before going for a headbutt.
On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.

abilities.name: Gorilla Tactics
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.

name: Maractus
descriptions: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Dwebble
descriptions: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Crustle
descriptions: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.
This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Scraggy
descriptions: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Scrafty
descriptions: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Sigilyph
descriptions: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

name: Yamask
descriptions: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.

abilities.name: Mummy
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Mummy.

name: Galarian Yamask
descriptions: It’s said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.
A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask’s dark power.

abilities.name: Wandering Spirit
abilities.description: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

name: Cofagrigus
descriptions: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.

abilities.name: Mummy
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Mummy.

name: Tirtouga
descriptions: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Carracosta
descriptions: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Archen
descriptions: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.
This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.

abilities.name: Defeatist
abilities.description: Halves the Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Archeops
descriptions: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.

abilities.name: Defeatist
abilities.description: Halves the Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Trubbish
descriptions: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.description: By releasing a stench when attacking, the Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

name: Garbodor
descriptions: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.description: By releasing a stench when attacking, the Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

name: Gigantamax Garbodor
descriptions: It sprays toxic gas from its mouth and fingers. If the gas engulfs you, the toxins will seep in all the way down to your bones.
Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.description: By releasing a stench when attacking, the Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

name: Zorua
descriptions: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

abilities.name: Illusion
abilities.description: The Pokémon fools opponents by entering battle disguised as the last Pokémon in its Trainer’s party.

name: Hisuian Zorua
descriptions: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

abilities.name: Illusion
abilities.description: The Pokémon fools opponents by entering battle disguised as the last Pokémon in its Trainer’s party.

name: Zoroark
descriptions: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.

abilities.name: Illusion
abilities.description: The Pokémon fools opponents by entering battle disguised as the last Pokémon in its Trainer’s party.

name: Hisuian Zoroark
descriptions: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.
With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.

abilities.name: Illusion
abilities.description: The Pokémon fools opponents by entering battle disguised as the last Pokémon in its Trainer’s party.

name: Minccino
descriptions: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: The Pokémon may infatuate attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Cinccino
descriptions: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: The Pokémon may infatuate attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Gothita
descriptions: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.
This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Gothorita
descriptions: Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokémon came from outer space.
This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Gothitelle
descriptions: It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.
Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe’s end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Solosis
descriptions: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

name: Duosion
descriptions: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

name: Reuniclus
descriptions: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

name: Ducklett
descriptions: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Swanna
descriptions: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Vanillite
descriptions: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

abilities.name: Snow Cloak
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in snow.

name: Vanillish
descriptions: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.

abilities.name: Snow Cloak
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in snow.

name: Vanilluxe
descriptions: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.

abilities.name: Ice Body
abilities.description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in snow.

name: Spring Form Deerling
descriptions: Despite Deerling’s adorable appearance, farmers consider it a nuisance since it loves plant shoots and will eat them all up.
Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In early spring, these Pokémon give off a delicate, sweet, and calming scent.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Summer Form Deerling
descriptions: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. When a distinct grassy smell starts to waft from one, you know that summer has begun.
To prevent Deerling from entering their fields, many farmers will have several Lycanroc stand guard, as they are the natural enemy of Deerling.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Autumn Form Deerling
descriptions: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.
These Pokémon are not shy—they will behave as they please, even in front of people. If you feed one of them, it will quickly take a liking to you.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Winter Form Deerling
descriptions: This Pokémon will playfully headbutt those it gets along well with. It has antlers hidden under its flower, so the headbutts are a little painful.
Deerling’s scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokémon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Spring Form Sawsbuck
descriptions: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The paler the pink flowers that bloom on its antlers, the more beautiful the Sawsbuck is considered to be.
It seems that a Sawsbuck with many flowers on its antlers will grow at a slightly slower pace because the flowers absorb the Pokémon’s nutrients.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Summer Form Sawsbuck
descriptions: This Pokémon’s leaves can be made into a black tea, the taste of which varies depending on the region of origin. Paldea’s is especially aromatic.
There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Autumn Form Sawsbuck
descriptions: Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are known for having very short tempers. The males fight each other incessantly.
There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Winter Form Sawsbuck
descriptions: Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.
It’s said that Sawsbuck are calm and easy to tame during the season when they take on this form, so it’s the perfect time to make one your partner.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Emolga
descriptions: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.
As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Karrablast
descriptions: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.
Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Escavalier
descriptions: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.
They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Foongus
descriptions: This Pokémon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.
There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.

abilities.name: Effect Spore
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on the attacker.

name: Amoonguss
descriptions: Amoonguss mimics Poké Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokémon.
Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss’s caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.

abilities.name: Effect Spore
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on the attacker.

name: Male
descriptions: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.
It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Female
descriptions: Its thin, veillike arms have tens of thousands of poisonous stingers. Females have slightly longer stingers.
It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Male
descriptions: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Female
descriptions: The crown on its head gets bigger and bigger as it absorbs more and more of the life-force of other creatures.
These Pokémon have body compositions that are mostly identical to seawater. They make their lairs from sunken ships.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Alomomola
descriptions: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: Cures the Pokémon’s status conditions in rain.

name: Joltik
descriptions: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.
Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.

name: Galvantula
descriptions: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.
It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.

name: Ferroseed
descriptions: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.
It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

abilities.name: Iron Barbs
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s iron barbs damage the attacker if it makes direct contact.

name: Ferrothorn
descriptions: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.
This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

abilities.name: Iron Barbs
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s iron barbs damage the attacker if it makes direct contact.

name: Klink
descriptions: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.
The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.

abilities.name: Plus
abilities.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Klang
descriptions: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.
When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.

abilities.name: Plus
abilities.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Klinklang
descriptions: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.
From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.

abilities.name: Plus
abilities.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Tynamo
descriptions: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.
While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Eelektrik
descriptions: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Eelektross
descriptions: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Elgyem
descriptions: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.
If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

name: Beheeyem
descriptions: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.
Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

name: Litwick
descriptions: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Lampent
descriptions: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Chandelure
descriptions: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.
This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Axew
descriptions: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.
This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s competitive spirit makes it deal more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less damage to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

name: Fraxure
descriptions: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.
Because its tusks don’t grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won’t use them unless truly necessary.

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s competitive spirit makes it deal more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less damage to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

name: Haxorus
descriptions: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.
This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s competitive spirit makes it deal more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less damage to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

name: Cubchoo
descriptions: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, you’ll get frostbite.
Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there’s a chance it is sick.

abilities.name: Snow Cloak
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in snow.

name: Beartic
descriptions: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.
It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.

abilities.name: Snow Cloak
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in snow.

name: Cryogonal
descriptions: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.
Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Shelmet
descriptions: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: Cures the Pokémon’s status conditions in rain.

name: Accelgor
descriptions: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: Cures the Pokémon’s status conditions in rain.

name: Stunfisk
descriptions: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Galarian Stunfisk
descriptions: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.
Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.

abilities.name: Mimicry
abilities.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type depending on the terrain.

name: Mienfoo
descriptions: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Mienshao
descriptions: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Druddigon
descriptions: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s rough skin damages attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Golett
descriptions: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.

abilities.name: Iron Fist
abilities.description: Powers up punching moves.

name: Golurk
descriptions: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.
Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.

abilities.name: Iron Fist
abilities.description: Powers up punching moves.

name: Pawniard
descriptions: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.
Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Bisharp
descriptions: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Bouffalant
descriptions: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

abilities.name: Reckless
abilities.description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

name: Rufflet
descriptions: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.
They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Braviary
descriptions: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Hisuian Braviary
descriptions: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.
Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Vullaby
descriptions: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.

abilities.name: Big Pecks
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon from having its Defense stat lowered.

name: Mandibuzz
descriptions: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.

abilities.name: Big Pecks
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon from having its Defense stat lowered.

name: Heatmor
descriptions: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Durant
descriptions: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Deino
descriptions: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.
It can’t see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.

abilities.name: Hustle
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but lowers its accuracy.

name: Zweilous
descriptions: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.
The two heads do not get along at all. If you don’t give each head the same amount of attention, they’ll begin fighting out of jealousy.

abilities.name: Hustle
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but lowers its accuracy.

name: Hydreigon
descriptions: It’s said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.
Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Larvesta
descriptions: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.
This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Volcarona
descriptions: This Pokémon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heat—it’s in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.
Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Cobalion
descriptions: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.

abilities.name: Justified
abilities.description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

name: Terrakion
descriptions: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

abilities.name: Justified
abilities.description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

name: Virizion
descriptions: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.

abilities.name: Justified
abilities.description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

name: Incarnate Forme
descriptions: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

abilities.name: Prankster
abilities.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s status moves.

name: Therian Forme
descriptions: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: The Pokémon has a little of its HP restored when withdrawn from battle.

name: Incarnate Forme
descriptions: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

abilities.name: Prankster
abilities.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s status moves.

name: Therian Forme
descriptions: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

abilities.name: Volt Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Reshiram
descriptions: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.
This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

abilities.name: Turboblaze
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Zekrom
descriptions: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

abilities.name: Teravolt
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Incarnate Forme
descriptions: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

abilities.name: Sand Force
abilities.description: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.

name: Therian Forme
descriptions: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Kyurem
descriptions: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Puts other Pokémon under pressure, causing them to expend more PP to use their moves.

name: White Kyurem
descriptions: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

abilities.name: Turboblaze
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Black Kyurem
descriptions: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

abilities.name: Teravolt
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Ordinary Form
descriptions: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

abilities.name: Justified
abilities.description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

name: Resolute Form
descriptions: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

abilities.name: Justified
abilities.description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

name: Aria Forme
descriptions: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Raises the likelihood of additional effects occurring when the Pokémon uses its moves.

name: Pirouette Forme
descriptions: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Raises the likelihood of additional effects occurring when the Pokémon uses its moves.

name: Genesect
descriptions: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

abilities.name: Download
abilities.description: The Pokémon compares an opposing Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.

name: Chespin
descriptions: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.
The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Quilladin
descriptions: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.
It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Chesnaught
descriptions: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Fennekin
descriptions: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Braixen
descriptions: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Delphox
descriptions: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Froakie
descriptions: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Frogadier
descriptions: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.
It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Greninja
descriptions: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Ash-Greninja
descriptions: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

abilities.name: Battle Bond
abilities.description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, its bond with its Trainer is strengthened, and its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats are boosted.

name: Bunnelby
descriptions: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

name: Diggersby
descriptions: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.
With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

name: Fletchling
descriptions: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.
This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.

abilities.name: Big Pecks
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon from having its Defense stat lowered.

name: Fletchinder
descriptions: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokémon should enter, it will show them no mercy.
Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Talonflame
descriptions: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.
It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Scatterbug
descriptions: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.
Any poison this Pokémon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. That’s why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.

abilities.name: Shield Dust
abilities.description: Protective dust shields the Pokémon from the additional effects of moves.

name: Spewpa
descriptions: Spewpa doesn’t live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.
If Rufflet attacks this Pokémon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Meadow Pattern Vivillon
