abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Nickit
descriptions: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Thievul
descriptions: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Gossifleur
descriptions: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: The Pokémon has a little of its HP restored when withdrawn from battle.

name: Eldegoss
descriptions: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: The Pokémon has a little of its HP restored when withdrawn from battle.

name: Wooloo
descriptions: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Dubwool
descriptions: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

abilities.name: Steadfast
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s determination boosts its Speed stat every time it flinches.

name: Chewtle
descriptions: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.
Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another Chewtle’s horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Drednaw
descriptions: Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.
Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokémon has an extremely vicious disposition.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Gigantamax Drednaw
descriptions: In the Galar region, there’s a tale about this Pokémon chewing up a mountain and using the rubble to stop a flood.
It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Yamper
descriptions: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

abilities.name: Ball Fetch
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.

name: Boltund
descriptions: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

abilities.name: Strong Jaw
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Rolycoly
descriptions: Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon’s body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.
On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.

abilities.name: Heatproof
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s heatproof body halves the damage taken from Fire-type moves.

name: Carkol
descriptions: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkol’s back never falls apart, even when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.
The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Coalossal
descriptions: It’s gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.
To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Gigantamax Coalossal
descriptions: When Galar was hit by a harsh cold wave, this Pokémon served as a giant heating stove and saved many lives.
Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémon’s flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Applin
descriptions: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.
It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apple’s skin and prevent it from rotting.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Flapple
descriptions: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.
It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponent’s guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Gigantamax Flapple
descriptions: If it stretches its neck, the strong aroma of its nectar pours out. The scent is so sickeningly sweet that one whiff makes other Pokémon faint.
Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Appletun
descriptions: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun’s back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.
It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Gigantamax Appletun
descriptions: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s nectar has thickened. The increased viscosity lets the nectar absorb more damage than before.
It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Silicobra
descriptions: Silicobra’s large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokémon is not very good at telling apart different smells.
Silicobra’s neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Sandaconda
descriptions: The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandaconda’s saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.
It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Gigantamax Sandaconda
descriptions: Sand swirls around its body with such speed and power that it could pulverize a skyscraper.
Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Cramorant
descriptions: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

abilities.name: Gulp Missile
abilities.description: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.

name: Arrokuda
descriptions: It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokuda’s eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.
Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

name: Barraskewda
descriptions: It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.
It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the water’s surface.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

name: Toxel
descriptions: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.
It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel’s body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Low Key Form Toxtricity
descriptions: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.
Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.

abilities.name: Minus
abilities.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Amped Form Toxtricity
descriptions: The jolts of electricity it launches by violently strumming the protrusions on its chest easily exceed 15,000 volts.
As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.

abilities.name: Plus
abilities.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Gigantamax Toxtricity
descriptions: Out of control after its own poison penetrated its brain, it tears across the land in a rampage, contaminating the earth with toxic sweat.
Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.

abilities.name: Plus
abilities.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Sizzlipede
descriptions: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Centiskorch
descriptions: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.
When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Gigantamax Centiskorch
descriptions: The heat that comes off a Gigantamax Centiskorch may destabilize air currents. Sometimes it can even cause storms.
Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Clobbopus
descriptions: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.
It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

abilities.name: Limber
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.

name: Grapploct
descriptions: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

abilities.name: Limber
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.

name: Sinistea
descriptions: Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.
The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.

abilities.name: Weak Armor
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s Defense stat is lowered when it takes damage from physical moves, but its Speed stat is sharply boosted.

name: Polteageist
descriptions: These Pokémon multiply by creeping into teapots and pouring themselves into leftover tea.
The tea that composes Polteageist’s body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.

abilities.name: Weak Armor
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s Defense stat is lowered when it takes damage from physical moves, but its Speed stat is sharply boosted.

name: Hatenna
descriptions: It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.
Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokémon prefers environments where no other creatures live.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

name: Hattrem
descriptions: The moment this Pokémon finds someone who’s emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.
To this Pokémon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noises—even if the emotions are happy ones.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

name: Hatterene
descriptions: Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterene’s territory.
Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

name: Gigantamax Hatterene
descriptions: Beams like lightning shoot down from its tentacles. It’s known to some as the Raging Goddess.
This Pokémon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

name: Impidimp
descriptions: They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.
The reason this Pokémon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it can’t absorb negative emotions.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Morgrem
descriptions: This Pokémon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. It’s popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.
Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesn’t have confidence in its brawn.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Grimmsnarl
descriptions: It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasn’t given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.
This Pokémon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Gigantamax Grimmsnarl
descriptions: Gigantamax energy has caused more hair to sprout all over its body. With the added strength, it can jump over the world’s tallest building.
By transforming its leg hair, this Pokémon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galar’s terrain.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Obstagoon
descriptions: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Perrserker
descriptions: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

abilities.name: Battle Armor
abilities.description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Cursola
descriptions: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.

abilities.name: Weak Armor
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s Defense stat is lowered when it takes damage from physical moves, but its Speed stat is sharply boosted.

name: Sirfetch’d
descriptions: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

abilities.name: Steadfast
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s determination boosts its Speed stat every time it flinches.

name: Mr.
descriptions: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

abilities.name: Tangled Feet
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness if it is confused.

name: Runerigus
descriptions: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

abilities.name: Wandering Spirit
abilities.description: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

name: Milcery
descriptions: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

abilities.name: Sweet Veil
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep.

name: Vanilla Cream Alcremie
descriptions: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.

abilities.name: Sweet Veil
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep.

name: Gigantamax Alcremie
descriptions: It launches swarms of missiles, each made of cream and loaded with 100,000 kilocalories. Get hit by one of these, and your head will swim.
Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémon’s body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.

abilities.name: Sweet Veil
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep.

name: Falinks
descriptions: The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when it’s time to change formation.
The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.

abilities.name: Battle Armor
abilities.description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Pincurchin
descriptions: This Pokémon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.
This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

name: Snom
descriptions: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.
It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.

abilities.name: Shield Dust
abilities.description: Protective dust shields the Pokémon from the additional effects of moves.

name: Frosmoth
descriptions: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.
Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.

abilities.name: Shield Dust
abilities.description: Protective dust shields the Pokémon from the additional effects of moves.

name: Stonjourner
descriptions: This Pokémon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.
The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokémon’s habitat.

abilities.name: Power Spot
abilities.description: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.

name: Eiscue
descriptions: If you lick the ice covering its face, you’ll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.
On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.

abilities.name: Ice Face
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon’s appearance. The ice will be restored when it snows.

name: Male Indeedee
descriptions: This Pokémon never leaves its Trainer’s side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.
This Pokémon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Female Indeedee
descriptions: In search of happy feelings—such as joy and gratitude—Indeedee bustles around, taking diligent care of people and other Pokémon.
It dislikes conflict. If a fight occurs in its territory, it uses psychic power to throw things at the combatants in an effort to drive them away.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

name: Full Belly Mode Morpeko
descriptions: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.

abilities.name: Hunger Switch
abilities.description: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of every turn.

name: Hangry Mode Morpeko
descriptions: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.
Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.

abilities.name: Hunger Switch
abilities.description: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of every turn.

name: Cufant
descriptions: Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokémon feed.
Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon’s moves, but increases the moves’ power.

name: Copperajah
descriptions: Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokémon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.
This Pokémon was brought to Paldea long ago by people from a faraway land. It’s so strong that it can easily pull an airplane.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon’s moves, but increases the moves’ power.

name: Gigantamax Copperajah
descriptions: After this Pokémon has Gigantamaxed, its massive nose can utterly demolish large structures with a single smashing blow.
So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon’s moves, but increases the moves’ power.

name: Dracozolt
descriptions: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

abilities.name: Volt Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Arctozolt
descriptions: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Dracovish
descriptions: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.
Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Arctovish
descriptions: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.
Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Duraludon
descriptions: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

abilities.name: Light Metal
abilities.description: Halves the Pokémon’s weight.

name: Gigantamax Duraludon
descriptions: The hardness of its cells is exceptional, even among Steel types. It also has a body structure that’s resistant to earthquakes.
It’s grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.

abilities.name: Light Metal
abilities.description: Halves the Pokémon’s weight.

name: Dreepy
descriptions: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn’t feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.
In the evening, groups of Dreepy will fly at high speeds over the ocean and poke at Pokémon in the water for fun.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

name: Drakloak
descriptions: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they’re all grown up.
This Pokémon flies around at over 120 miles per hour. If a Drakloak is defeated in a battle, its Dreepy will wander off without a second thought.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

name: Dragapult
descriptions: The fastest Dragapult of the group is always surrounded by Dreepy that want to fly at sonic speed.
Dragapult can make its whole body transparent by clearing its mind and focusing. Even the Dreepy in Dragapult’s horns become invisible.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

name: Hero of Many Battles Zacian
descriptions: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.

abilities.name: Intrepid Sword
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat the first time the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Crowned Sword Zacian
descriptions: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King’s Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.
Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

abilities.name: Intrepid Sword
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat the first time the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Hero of Many Battles Zamazenta
descriptions: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

abilities.name: Dauntless Shield
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat the first time the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Crowned Shield Zamazenta
descriptions: Now that it’s equipped with its shield, it can shrug off impressive blows, including the attacks of Dynamax Pokémon.
Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master’s Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

abilities.name: Dauntless Shield
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat the first time the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Eternatus
descriptions: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Puts other Pokémon under pressure, causing them to expend more PP to use their moves.

name: Kubfu
descriptions: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Single Strike Style
descriptions: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.

abilities.name: Unseen Fist
abilities.description: If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

name: Rapid Strike Style
descriptions: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.
It’s believed that this Pokémon modeled its fighting style on the flow of a river—sometimes rapid, sometimes calm.

abilities.name: Unseen Fist
abilities.description: If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

name: Gigantamax Urshifu (Single Strike Style)
descriptions: The energy released by this Pokémon’s fists forms shock waves that can blow away Dynamax Pokémon in just one hit.
People call it the embodiment of rage. It’s said that this Pokémon’s terrifying expression and shout will rid the world of malevolence.

abilities.name: Unseen Fist
abilities.description: If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

name: Gigantamax Urshifu (Rapid Strike Style)
descriptions: All it takes is a glare from this Pokémon to take the lives of those with evil in their hearts—or so they say.
As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokémon maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It won’t even twitch.

abilities.name: Unseen Fist
abilities.description: If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

name: Zarude
descriptions:
Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they
become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants
of the forest grow.
Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

abilities.name: Leaf Guard
abilities.description: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Regieleki
descriptions: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.
This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.

abilities.name: Transistor
abilities.description: Powers up Electric-type moves.

name: Regidrago
descriptions: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.
An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.

abilities.name: Dragon’s Maw
abilities.description: Powers up Dragon-type moves.

name: Glastrier
descriptions: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.
Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.

abilities.name: Chilling Neigh
abilities.description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat.

name: Spectrier
descriptions: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.

abilities.name: Grim Neigh
abilities.description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Sp. Atk stat.

name: Calyrex
descriptions: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.description: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

name: Ice Rider Calyrex
descriptions: It’s said that this Pokémon once moved a large forest—and all the Pokémon living there—to a new location overnight.
According to lore, this Pokémon showed no mercy to those who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents’ wounds after battle.

abilities.name: As One
abilities.description:
This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex’s
Unnerve Ability and Glastrier’s Chilling Neigh Ability.

name: Shadow Rider Calyrex
descriptions: Legend says that by using its power to see all events from past to future, this Pokémon saved the creatures of a forest from a meteorite strike.
It’s said that Calyrex and a Pokémon that had bonded with it ran all across the Galar region to bring green to the wastelands.

abilities.name: As One
abilities.description: This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex’s Unnerve Ability and Spectrier’s Grim Neigh Ability.

name: Wyrdeer
descriptions: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Kleavor
descriptions: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.
A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Ursaluna
descriptions: I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Male Basculegion
descriptions: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

name: Female Basculegion
descriptions: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

name: Sneasler
descriptions: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Puts other Pokémon under pressure, causing them to expend more PP to use their moves.

name: Overqwil
descriptions: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

name: Incarnate Forme Enamorus
descriptions: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: The Pokémon may infatuate attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Therian Forme Enamorus
descriptions: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.
A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.

abilities.name: Overcoat
abilities.description: The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms. It is also protected from the effects of powders and spores.

name: Sprigatito
descriptions: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokémon is in the sun.
Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Floragato
descriptions: The hardness of Floragato’s fur depends on the Pokémon’s mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.
Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Meowscarada
descriptions: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize what’s going on.
This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Fuecoco
descriptions: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.
It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Crocalor
descriptions: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.
The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Skeledirge
descriptions: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.
The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Quaxly
descriptions: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.
This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Quaxwell
descriptions: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokémon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.
These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Quaquaval
descriptions: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.
A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Lechonk
descriptions: This Pokémon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokémon detest.
It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Male Oinkologne
descriptions: It entrances female Pokémon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.
Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Female Oinkologne
descriptions: This is a meticulous Pokémon that likes to keep things tidy. It shrouds itself in a floral aroma that soothes the Pokémon around it.
This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

name: Tarountula
descriptions: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread’s strength is the topic of ongoing research.
The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s insomnia prevents it from falling asleep.

name: Spidops
descriptions: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.
It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s insomnia prevents it from falling asleep.

name: Nymble
descriptions: It’s highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.
It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Lokix
descriptions: It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it can’t stay in this mode for long.
When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Pawmi
descriptions: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.
It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Pawmo
descriptions: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.
When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s status conditions are cured when it switches out.

name: Pawmot
descriptions: Pawmot’s fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.
This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s status conditions are cured when it switches out.

name: Tandemaus
descriptions: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.
Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Maushold (Family of Four)
descriptions: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.
The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.

abilities.name: Cheek Pouch
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s HP is restored when it eats any Berry, in addition to the Berry’s usual effect.

name: Maushold (Family of Three)
descriptions: The little one just appeared one day. They all live together like a family, but the relationship between the three is still unclear.
They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.

abilities.name: Cheek Pouch
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s HP is restored when it eats any Berry, in addition to the Berry’s usual effect.

name: Fidough
descriptions: The yeast in Fidough’s breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokémon has been protected by people since long ago.
This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon’s vicinity.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: The Pokémon sticks to its own tempo, preventing it from becoming confused or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Dachsbun
descriptions: The surface of this Pokémon’s skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.
The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.

abilities.name: Well-Baked Body
abilities.description: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Fire-type moves. Instead, its Defense stat is sharply boosted.

name: Smoliv
descriptions: This Pokémon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.
It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

abilities.name: Early Bird
abilities.description: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

name: Dolliv
descriptions: It basks in the sun to its heart’s content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.
Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

abilities.name: Early Bird
abilities.description: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

name: Arboliva
descriptions: This Pokémon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.
This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.

abilities.name: Seed Sower
abilities.description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

name: Green Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptions: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they’re out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.
These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Blue Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptions: Blue-feathered Squawkabilly view their green-feathered counterparts as rivals, since the latter make up the largest, most powerful groups.
The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Yellow Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptions: The yellow Squawkabilly are especially fierce. They’ve even been known to drive other bird Pokémon out of town.
These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. They’ll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: White Plumage Squawkabilly
descriptions: Though these Squawkabilly are the fewest in number, they have no trouble living in towns since they blend in with the white buildings.
This Pokémon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Nacli
descriptions: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Nacli’s body.
It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Naclstack
descriptions: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.
This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Garganacl
descriptions: Many Pokémon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.
Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

name: Charcadet
descriptions: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.
Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Armarouge
descriptions: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.
Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Ceruledge
descriptions: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.
The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

name: Tadbulb
descriptions: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.
Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Bellibolt
descriptions: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt’s belly-button dynamo.
When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

name: Wattrel
descriptions: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.
When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

abilities.name: Volt Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Kilowattrel
descriptions: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There’s hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.
Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

abilities.name: Volt Absorb
abilities.description: If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Maschiff
descriptions: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.
It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Mabosstiff
descriptions: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.
This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

name: Shroodle
descriptions: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.
Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

abilities.name: Unburden
abilities.description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon’s held item is used or lost.

name: Grafaiai
descriptions: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.
The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

abilities.name: Unburden
abilities.description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon’s held item is used or lost.

name: Bramblin
descriptions: Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.
A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.

abilities.name: Wind Rider
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat if Tailwind takes effect or if the Pokémon is hit by a wind move. The Pokémon also takes no damage from wind moves.

name: Brambleghast
descriptions: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokémon will bury an entire town.
It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.

abilities.name: Wind Rider
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat if Tailwind takes effect or if the Pokémon is hit by a wind move. The Pokémon also takes no damage from wind moves.

name: Toedscool
descriptions: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.
Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.

abilities.name: Mycelium Might
abilities.description: The Pokémon will always act more slowly when using status moves, but these moves will be unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Toedscruel
descriptions: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.
These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.

abilities.name: Mycelium Might
abilities.description: The Pokémon will always act more slowly when using status moves, but these moves will be unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Klawf
descriptions: This Pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.
Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Capsakid
descriptions: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.
The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Scovillain
descriptions: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Rellor
descriptions: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.
This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.

name: Rabsca
descriptions: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.
The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

name: Flittle
descriptions: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.
Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Espathra
descriptions: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.
It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Tinkatink
descriptions: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it’s satisfied with the result.
It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: The Pokémon sticks to its own tempo, preventing it from becoming confused or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Tinkatuff
descriptions: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other’s hammers by smashing them together.
This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: The Pokémon sticks to its own tempo, preventing it from becoming confused or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Tinkaton
descriptions: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.
This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: The Pokémon sticks to its own tempo, preventing it from becoming confused or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Wiglett
descriptions: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.
This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

abilities.name: Gooey
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

name: Wugtrio
descriptions: A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.
It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

abilities.name: Gooey
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

name: Bombirdier
descriptions: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.
It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

name: Finizen
descriptions: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.
It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

abilities.name: Water Veil
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s water veil prevents it from being burned.

name: Zero Form Palafin
descriptions: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.

abilities.name: Zero to Hero
abilities.description: The Pokémon transforms into its Hero Form when it switches out.

name: Hero Form Palafin
descriptions: This hero of the ocean swims at a speed of 50 knots and saves drowning people and Pokémon.
This Pokémon’s ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.

abilities.name: Zero to Hero
abilities.description: The Pokémon transforms into its Hero Form when it switches out.

name: Varoom
descriptions: The steel section is Varoom’s actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.
It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

abilities.name: Overcoat
abilities.description: The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms. It is also protected from the effects of powders and spores.

name: Revavroom
descriptions: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.
It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders—now numbering eight—to generate energy.

abilities.name: Overcoat
abilities.description: The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms. It is also protected from the effects of powders and spores.

name: Cyclizar
descriptions: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The rider’s body heat warms Cyclizar’s back and lifts the Pokémon’s spirit.
Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Orthworm
descriptions: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.
When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.

abilities.name: Earth Eater
abilities.description: If hit by a Ground-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

name: Glimmet
descriptions: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.
It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

abilities.name: Toxic Debris
abilities.description: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon takes damage from physical moves.

name: Glimmora
descriptions: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.
When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.

abilities.name: Toxic Debris
abilities.description: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon takes damage from physical moves.

name: Greavard
descriptions: This friendly Pokémon doesn’t like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.
It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

name: Houndstone
descriptions: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn’t like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.
Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.

abilities.name: Sand Rush
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm.

name: Flamigo
descriptions: Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as “synchronizing,” an entire flock of these Pokémon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.
This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

abilities.name: Tangled Feet
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness if it is confused.

name: Cetoddle
descriptions: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.
This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Cetitan
descriptions: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.
This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Veluza
descriptions: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.
When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

abilities.name: Mold Breaker
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

name: Dondozo
descriptions: It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.
This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

abilities.name: Oblivious
abilities.description: The Pokémon is oblivious, keeping it from being infatuated, falling for taunts, or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Curly Form Tatsugiri
descriptions: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

abilities.name: Commander
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it goes inside the mouth of an ally Dondozo if one is on the field. The Pokémon then issues commands from there.

name: Droopy Form Tatsugiri
descriptions: This Pokémon tricks its opponents by playing dead. It is small and weak, but it uses its smarts to survive.
This species’ differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.

abilities.name: Commander
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it goes inside the mouth of an ally Dondozo if one is on the field. The Pokémon then issues commands from there.

name: Stretchy Form Tatsugiri
descriptions: It’s one of the most intelligent dragon Pokémon. It camouflages itself by inflating its throat sac.
Bird Pokémon are its main prey. This Pokémon knows it’s weak, so it hunts with a partner.

abilities.name: Commander
abilities.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it goes inside the mouth of an ally Dondozo if one is on the field. The Pokémon then issues commands from there.

name: Annihilape
descriptions: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.
When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

name: Clodsire
descriptions: It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.
When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

name: Farigiraf
descriptions: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.
Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.

abilities.name: Cud Chew
abilities.description: When the Pokémon eats a Berry, it will regurgitate that Berry at the end of the next turn and eat it one more time.
