name: Two-Segment Form Dudunsparce
descriptions: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.
This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Three-Segment Form Dudunsparce
descriptions: A recent study uncovered that the number of segments a Dudunsparce’s body has is determined by the Pokémon’s genes.
The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokémon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Kingambit
descriptions: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it’s not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.
Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.

abilities.name: Defiant
abilities.description: If the Pokémon has any stat lowered by an opposing Pokémon, its Attack stat will be boosted sharply.

name: Great
descriptions: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.
Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Scream
descriptions: It resembles a mysterious Pokémon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.
There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Brute
descriptions: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Flutter
descriptions: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Slither
descriptions: This Pokémon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.
This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Sandy
descriptions: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.
No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.
This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.
Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.
It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.
It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.
This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.
It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Frigibax
descriptions: This Pokémon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.
Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

abilities.name: Thermal Exchange
abilities.description: Boosts the Attack stat when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.

name: Arctibax
descriptions: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibax’s strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.
Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

abilities.name: Thermal Exchange
abilities.description: Boosts the Attack stat when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.

name: Baxcalibur
descriptions: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.
This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

abilities.name: Thermal Exchange
abilities.description: Boosts the Attack stat when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.

name: Chest Form Gimmighoul
descriptions: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémon.
This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

abilities.name: Rattled
abilities.description: The Pokémon gets scared when hit by a Dark-, Ghost-, or Bug-type attack or if intimidated, which boosts its Speed stat.

name: Roaming Form Gimmighoul
descriptions: It wanders around, carrying an old coin on its back. It survives by draining the life-force from humans who try to pick up its coin.
This Pokémon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Gholdengo
descriptions: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.
Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.

abilities.name: Good as Gold
abilities.description: A body of pure, solid gold gives the Pokémon full immunity to other Pokémon’s status moves.

name: Wo-Chien
descriptions: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.
The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.

abilities.name: Tablets of Ruin
abilities.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous wooden tablets lowers the Attack stats of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Chien-Pao
descriptions: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.
This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.

abilities.name: Sword of Ruin
abilities.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous sword lowers the Defense stats of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Ting-Lu
descriptions: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.
The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.

abilities.name: Vessel of Ruin
abilities.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous vessel lowers the Sp. Atk stats of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Chi-Yu
descriptions: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.
It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.

abilities.name: Beads of Ruin
abilities.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous beads lowers the Sp. Def stats of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Roaring
descriptions: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.
It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.
It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Koraidon
descriptions: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.
This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.

abilities.name: Orichalcum Pulse
abilities.description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle. The ancient pulse thrumming through the Pokémon also boosts its Attack stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Miraidon
descriptions: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.

abilities.name: Hadron Engine
abilities.description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle. The futuristic engine within the Pokémon also boosts its Sp. Atk stat on Electric Terrain.

name: Walking
descriptions: Ecology under research.
Ecology under research.

abilities.name: Protosynthesis
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.

name: Iron
descriptions: Ecology under analysis.
Ecology under analysis.

abilities.name: Quark Drive
abilities.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain or if the Pokémon is holding Booster Energy.
